result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin E Roth

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dustin E Roth in court.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court for Dustin E Roth.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for DPA hearing. For reasons stated, parties request an adjourned date. Court grants. Case adjourned, Branch 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dustin E Roth appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle appeared by video for Dustin E Roth.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in resolution posture for DPA. TAD evaluation has been done. State needs to further review DPA offer. Case adjourned in Branch 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dustin E Roth in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense seeking DPA resolution.  Case adjourned for status conference, Branch 30 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dustin E Roth in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dustin E Roth appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status. Defense requests more time. Case adjourned to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dustin E Roth in court with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dustin E Roth appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for status. State advises the Court this case is in DPA posture. Defense requests a status to allow time for TAD and DPA to be drafted. 
Court orders matter adjourned back to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dustin E Roth in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: MK.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Patrick Earle as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Patrick Earle accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $75.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 8/1/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Br. 30.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Dustin E Roth in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dustin E Roth appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defendant had problems with connection on zoom.  Court will schedule case for an inperson hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (3/31/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Target located at 7800 S Lovers Lane Road, Franklin, WI
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dustin E Roth in court.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/29/22 @ 2p
